code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient with C/O severe increased thirst for 6 weeks that is frequent. pt also reports moderate parethesia in lower limbs, moderate lethargy, Diabetes. patient is a white F aged 44 Ys. she states she has never smoked a cigarette in her life ocas ETOH on w/e o:Height 66 in, Weight 104 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 86, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 15, Basic Metabolic Panel BUN=30 mg/dL,creatinine=2 mg/dL, Arterial Blood Gas 6.0,HCO3=17 meq/L, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:administered insulin aspart - 100 mg/mL subcutaneous daily, performed Basic Metabolic Panel, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

meq/L , rectal exam = normal , no masses found , Eyes = OD:

td.content: s:a white female pianist aged 45 years presents with severe increased thirst, moderate lethargy, moderate parethesia in lower limbs and Diabetes for 4 days. she has a history of Type 1 Diabetes for past 3 years. occasional EtOH she denies smoking o:Height 65 in, Weight 102 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 67, Respiration 16, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and referred patient to endocrinology.

td.content: s:female aged 45 yrs presents with moderate parethesia in lower limbs, severe increased thirst, moderate lethargy and Diabetes. she is having symptoms 3-4 times a week, in spite of treatment. occasional EtOH Denies ever using tobacco o:Height 65 in, Weight 102 lbs, Temperature 98.1 F, Pulse 70, SystolicBP 105, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, rectal exam = normal, no masses found, Eyes = OD: 20/150, OU:20/100, normal pupillary reflex, DTRs: 2+ throughout, sensation = decreased pinprick sensation B/L lower extremity, appears in NAD, appropriate speech, Neuro = CN 2-12 intact, motor: 5/5 strength throughout, Extremities = B/L 2+ pitting edema throughout a:Type 1 Diabetes p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and ordered HbA1c.
